children.subject:
FA19: I'm taking 61c, 168, and 186. It's doable, I definitely have a lot of free time, but there's always something to study and work on. 186 has 5 projects, each given 2 weeks to complete, and 2 midterms. 168 only has 2 projects, 1 midterm, and nothing else. So you may find 186 + 168 a chill combo, especially if you finish 186 projects fast(go to Office Hours early, the later you go, the more people will show up).

However, 61c has, on many occasions, taking a lot of my time and attention, making it difficult to keep on track with 186 and 168. There was a 3 week period in which I had multiple projects, hws, and a midterm each week.

Swapping 61c with 127, i'm not sure which is more work, but expect to have a busy semester and a tough beginning to October(168 project + the most difficult 186 project + midterms for both).

SP19: There's some posts on Piazza that say 162 and 189 will be a very difficult semester. You can definitely do it, especially if you work hard and have a current great ability to learn and work fast, but I would self reflect and talk to people in person to figure out if this schedule is best for you.

Maybe:

126 61c

127 162

189 186

Feel free to add what you can handle.

I'd say 186 and 168 are less of must take classes and they are also light-loaded so it's fine to mix with heavy loaded class like 189/126/162, but you NEVER want to take 189 and 162 together regardless of the professors teaching it. Also I don't think 127 is necessary pre-req for 189 (but 126 is) , and can be taken jointly since the linear algebra review in first half of 127 & 189 will work nicely for both courses. While 182 doesn't really require extensive 189 background, I don't think it makes sense to take deep learning course before even knowing what machine learning is (the grading is also harsh for 182). 

I'd go for

Sp19: 126 61C 186 

Fa19: 127 189 168/161

Sp20: 162 182 [grad course like 267]

history.content:
Hey guys, 

I am a junior EECS student who has currently taken 61AB, Physics 7AB, EE16AB, Math 53/54, Data 8/100, CS170 and CS188 amongst relevant technical coursework. 

I am interested in the following courses: 61C, 126, 127, 189, 162, 186, 168, 182

Unfortunately, I feel like there is not enough time to fill it all without making the semesters very hard. I am an OK student, but nothing special (around a ~3.3-ish GPA).

I have currently enrolled for 61C, 186, and 126, but have heard that can get very tough. I would really appreciate in how I could order those 8 courses into a manageable schedule. Also, if anyone has anyone advice on which of those is skippable, I'd be very interested in that information as well.

The more I think about it, the more I was beginning to consider the following schedule:

SP19 - 126, 61C

FA19 - 127, 168, 186

SP19 - 189, 162, 182

Thoughts, recommendations on the difficulty of this? Any modifications I should make to the plan based on what I have said above? Any classes I can reasonable leave out of these? Thanks a ton in advance!
history.subject: Scheduling recommendations for last 3 semesters.
